issue.title: Add support for building on OpenBSD
issue.body:
See title. I added some additional instructions in the Readme that explain the OpenBSD specific steps in the build process.
The changes to picnic were necessary to prevent a double definition error.

One thing that would be nice to have, that i haven't figured out how to do right (since I'm not too familiar with automake) would be setting the default compiler to clang for OpenBSD.
OpenBSD's gcc is based on an old version that does not support several of the newer compilation flags used in the build process and thus can not build this project.

comment.body: Thanks Tobias!  Do you happen to know of any continuous integration service that supports OpenBSD that we could use to make sure the OpenBSD build keeps working?

issue.title: Building OpenSSH without PQ auth against liboqs-nist causes bug
issue.body: PQ auth in OpenSSH has to be disabled when using liboqs nist-branch because of the different signature API.  This is mostly the case, but there's still a compilation error.  See https://circleci.com/gh/open-quantum-safe/testing/130.

issue.title: Add hybrid PQ auth
issue.body:
Similar to OpenSSL's hybrid auth strategy.

Dev on top of PR #22.

issue.title: Need help to compile - OQS_KEM_bike3_l1_ossl_add errors
issue.body:
Hi'!
I need help, when I type in @ terminal: "make -j"

...then I got a few errors:

How can I fix that?


licit-function-declaration]
  if (BN_GF2m_add(r, a, b) == 0) {
      ^~~~~~~~~~~
      BN_mod_add

comment.body:
don't work with NIST-branch:

both:
make install NO_SHARED=1 PREFIX=/usr/local/ssl/oqs
or
make install-noshared PREFIX=/usr/local/ssl/oqs

mkdir -p /usr/local/ssl/oqs/include
mkdir -p /usr/local/ssl/oqs/lib
rm -f -r /usr/local/ssl/oqs/include/oqs
rm -f /usr/local/ssl/oqs/lib/liboqs.a
rm -f /usr/local/ssl/oqs/lib/liboqs.so
cp -r include/oqs /usr/local/ssl/oqs/include
cp liboqs.a /usr/local/ssl/oqs/lib
cp: cannot stat 'liboqs.a': No such file or directory
make: *** [Makefile:180: install-noshared] Error 1

how can I fix that?

comment.body: liboqs.a is the OQS library needed by the OpenSSL fork; did you install it? See [step 2](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl#step-2-build-liboqs) of the readme.

issue.title: Key sizes and ciphertext sizes
issue.body: Can we confirm that ALL public-key/secret-key sizes and ciphertext sizes are fixed for a given scheme? (unlike signature sizes, which can vary when signing twice with the same scheme)

comment.body: Now that I think about it, the actual keypair/encaps/decaps functions don't dynamically allocate memory, don't take lengths as inputs, and the don't return lengths as output; they assume that they are passed at least as much memory as the length\_* members indicate.  They may or may not use all of that memory, but we always treat that memory as opaque.  So I would say that yes, we can assume these sizes are fixed for a given KEM.
